snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown, blaming the drought for the infestation of native bark beetles, declared a state of emergency and requested federal help to remove dead and drying trees.
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown requests emergency federal aid to deal with pervasive die-off of trees throughout state, crisis he categorizes as being of historic magnitude; extended drought has increased vulnerability of millions of trees to native bark beetles.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown, blaming the drought for the infestation of native bark beetles, declared a state of emergency and requested federal help to remove dead and drying trees.

headline.main: California Seeks Federal Aid as Bark Beetles Destroy Trees
headline.print_headline: California Seeks U.S. Aid as Beetles Destroy Trees
